content:
1. Kip Thorne, Nobel Prize winner in Physics for contributions to the detection of gravitational waves.
2. Condoleezza Rice, former United States Secretary of State and National Security Advisor.
3. Paul Milgrom, Nobel Prize winner in Economics for contributions to auction theory.
4. Robert Sapolsky, prominent neuroendocrinologist and writer on stress and human behavior.
5. Jennifer Doudna, Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry for development of CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing technology.
6. Sheryl Sandberg, author and COO of Facebook.
7. Michael Levitt, Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry for work on computational models of complex chemical systems.
8. Andrew Ng, pioneer in the field of artificial intelligence and co-founder of Coursera.
9. Anne-Marie Slaughter, political scientist and former Director of Policy Planning at the United States Department of State.
10. Walter Isaacson, journalist and biographer who has written several bestselling books on figures such as Steve Jobs, Albert Einstein, and Benjamin Franklin.
